node.title: James Jeggo handball costs Socceroos in draw with China
node.alt: Two people in red soccer uniforms celebrate with pumped fists
node.description: A penalty given against James Jeggo leaves Australia with a disappointing draw against China in their World Cup qualifier.Â
node.content:
["The Socceroos have been held to a potentially damaging 1-1 draw by China in their World Cup qualifier in Sharjah.", "Despite dominating possession and play for much of the match a VAR review turned the game in the 66th minute.", "Having already given away a free-kick which was then whipped into the area by Chinese striker Ai Kesen, James Jeggo went up for the clearing header, his arms raised and away\u00a0from his body.", "Replays confirmed the ball hit Jeggo's outstretched arm and a penalty was given.", "China midfielder Wu Lei then buried\u00a0the penalty past Mat Ryan in the Australia goal and Australia could not find another goal as it was China who looked the better towards the end of the match.", "Socceroos coach Graham Arnold considered it a turning point in the match.", "The penalty cancelled out Mitch Duke's first half goal, which came when\u00a0he scored with a powerful downward header in the 38th minute, off a Martin Boyle cross.", "Australia had been dominant for much of the first half and had multiple chances, whereas China only had two.", "China's nationalised Brazilian-born striker Alan forced Ryan into a diving save in just the third minute but China only had one other chance in the opening half \u2014 a\u00a0speculative volley from\u00a0Luo Guofu which sailed wide after Ryan had come off his line with a clearing header.", "", "
Mitch Duke took full advantage of his size to rise above China's defenders and score a header.(Neville Hopwood/Getty Images)
", "In contrast\u00a0Duke's goal was one of many good chances that Australia had throughout the first 45 minutes but where teammates Jackson Irvine and Matthew Leckie spurned their opportunities\u00a0Duke buried his to give Australia the lead.", "Neither Duke nor Ryan were satisfied with the performance, which has left Australia 5 points adrift of Saudi Arabia, who earlier beat Vietnam 1-0,\u00a0at the top of the group.", "\"Very\u00a0frustrating to go away with just the one point,\" Duke said.", "\"I was lucky to get my head on a\u00a0great cross from Boyley but it wasn't enough to get the three points.\"", "Ryan, who aside from being sent the wrong way on the penalty, played well, was equally frustrated.", "\"Disappointing one tonight,\" he said.", "\"I don't think we did enough and didn't create enough clear cut chances.\""]
